title: Smallest Inverse Euler Totient Function
text:
This task is the inverse ofETFproblem, given an integernfind smallest integerisuch that φ(i)=n, where φ denotesEuler's totient function.InputThe first line is an integerT(1 ≤T≤ 100,000), denoting the number of test cases. Then, T test cases follow.For each test case, there is an integern(1 ≤n≤ 100,000,000) written in one line. (one integer per line)OutputFor each test case, output Smallest Inverse Euler's Totient Function ofn. ifndoesn't have inverse, output -1.ExampleInput:5
10
20
30
40
50Output:11
25
31
41
-1Time Limit ≈ 3*(My Program Top Speed)See also:Another problem added by Tjandra Satria Gunawan
